messages.message:
@Jag, @Serena

> will it be possible to configure a retention period for all deployments in an environment?
Currently, I don’t think this is an env-wide configuration, but we can extend it to include such functionality. As per the scope of this ticket, this feature will delete all associated data for runs and cannot be configured to only clean up the docs table.

> what about old deployments created before the implementation of this feature?
Will support deleting older deployments as well.

> If this is in the later stages, perf improvements should happen quite soon.
retention period functionality still needs to be implemented, but bulk deletion of runs is in the later stages jira (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/FLOW-10295)

cc @Anil - please correct If I’m missing something
started a new thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CSY11CK7T/p1732207040347519) to follow up since this one will ping too many folks!
@sean.donohoe Where do I run those commands above to access the db for crafting-cyp? I'd like to run a query on it but i'm not able to use grafana since its not mysql

Create a sandbox pointing to crafting-cyp, then follow instructions at the bottom of this document. https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/2582773768/Database+-+Runbook+Troubleshooting (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/2582773768/Database+-+Runbook+Troubleshooting)
@Udit you'd run those in your current sandbox if you want to use that -- creating a new sandbox is not required :slightly_smiling_face:

do we know the database host, user, password, etc is? I'm trying to connect to the db from the terminal but unsure what to use.

I just ran this to access the pod: `kubectl exec -it -n intes-use2-crafting-cyp-instabase dbg-mysql -- /bin/bash`

Sorry, my first time doing this stuff :sweat_smile:
yeah should be at the end of @Victor Zeng's doc -- `kubectl get secret db-backend-params -o json | jq -r ".data.db_string" | base64 -d`
